intro: Chenopodium album subsp. collinsii, commonly known as common lambsquarters, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring alternate, lanceolate leaves with a bluish-green hue and a rough texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, followed by dry, three-angled seed capsules. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields, gardens, and along roadsides. This species is known for its rapid growth and ability to tolerate various environmental conditions.
